sakai:pagecontent:
RACHEL BUTLER
123 S. University
Ann Arbor, MI 48105
(734)123-4567
janedoe@umich.edu
FIELD PLACEMENT OBJECTIVE
  A position as an intern in the adult in-patient program at the University of Michigan Hospital Department of Psychiatry.
HIGHLIGHTS
 
  • Ten years of counseling and clinical work in hospital, nursing home and private settings.
  • Training as a hospital chaplain, psychiatric technician and competency evaluated nursing attendant.
  • Design, planning, implementation and direction of the Dementia Day Care Unit at the Ingham County Medical Care Facility, Ingham County, MI.
  • One year of one-on-one counseling/support for fifty, room-bound residents at the Ingham County Medical Care Facility, Ingham County, MI.
RELEVANT SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
COUNSELING SKILLS
 
  • One year of counseling and family support work with terminal HIV and cancer patients at St. Lawrence Hospital, Lansing, MI.
  • Ten years of pastoral counseling at Holy Cross Parish, Lansing, MI.
  • Eight years experience in pastoral counseling on the adult and geriatric psychiatric units at St. Lawrence Hospital, Lansing, MI.
CLINICAL SKILLS
 
  • Creation of new and modification of existing techniques for the treatment of geriatric patients with advanced dementia and disruptive behaviors (Ingham County Medical Care Facility, Ingham County, MI).
  • Clinically trained as a Psychiatric Technician (St. Lawrence Hospital, Lansing, MI).
  • One year of work in physical medicine as a competency evaluated nursing attendant (Ingham County Medical Care Facility, Ingham County, MI).
GERIATRIC DEMENTIA AND DEPRESSION
 
  • Design and implementation of a dementia day care program that eliminated or reduced disruptive behavior in participating residents (Ingham Co. Medical Care Facility).
  • Relevant training: Clinical Pastoral Education, one year at St. Lawrence/Pine Rest Hospitals; Two years of course work and clinical practice, Psychiatric Technician Program, Lansing Community College; Six months of training as a Competency Evaluated Nursing Attendant (Ingham County Intermediate School District, Ingham County, MI).
WORK HISTORY
1998-1999 Activities Coordinator HILLTOPPERS ADULT DAY CARE CENTER, Lansing, MI
1999-2002 CENA, Therapeutic Activities Specialist, Dementia Unit Director INGHAM COUNTY MEDICAL CARE FACILITY, Okemos, MI
2002-2003 Director SHARE, MICHIGAN, Lansing, MI
2003-2005 Department Director CITY OF LANSING - Administrative Services Department, MI
EDUCATION
  Master of Social Work, University of Michigan (expected December 2008)
Master of Arts, Political Science, University of Missouri
Bachelor of Arts, English, University of Missouri
